author: arnetheduck
content: I'm curious why the two were combined - for example, having a block root accumulator separate would have allowed for trivial verification of blocks all the way back to genesis, which in turn could make syncing them easier / faster to verify

author: .vbuterin
content: Why would having a separate block root accumulator allow trivial verification?

author: arnetheduck
content: the block root accumulator is basically an extended merkle tree of the block roots in the state, or in other words the blocks themselves, so if one packages the blocks in blobs of `SLOTS_PER_HISTORICAL_ROOT` slots, they can all be hash-verified with the one root in the accumulator - as is, it gets trickier, one can get the state roots from the blocks but if there are slot gaps, its harder

author: arnetheduck
content: what would be nice about that root in particular would be that 8k blocks (slots) is a nice round number for "secondary" block storage and distribution and the accumulated block root would identify that set of blocks - we're thinking of storing 8k blocks + state in "era" files that are basically ssz dumps that could be easily distributed by any means, specially for long-term cold storage: https://github.com/status-im/nimbus-eth2/blob/unstable/docs/e2store.md#era-files
